Package de.oth.blocklib.world.chunks

Class Chunk

java.lang.Object
de.oth.blocklib.world.chunks.Chunk
public class Chunk
extends java.lang.Object
A Chunk, represented as a array of BlockType. There needs to be a mesh created to render it.
Author:
Tobias Zink, edit: Tobias Mueller, Stefan Hofweber, Chris Ebbinger

  • Field Summary

    Fields 
    Modifier and Type Field Description
    private int blockCount  
    private BlockStorage blockStorage
    array of short (BlockId) with all blocks inside
    private boolean changedFromOriginal
    Flag indicates, if the chunk was changed in a way, that it has to be saved, because it cant be recreated
    int chunkSize
    size of the world^3

    indicates whether meshing should be forced after being loaded or any additional preconditions have to be matched first

      public void setBlock​(int x, int y, int z, short blockId)

      Parameters:
      x - x array position
      y - y array position
      z - z array position
      blockId - type

    • setCrack

      public void setCrack​(int x, int y, int z, float amount)
      This sets the amount for the crack texture overlay when player breaks block. TODO change the amount type to int to better use each bit in the data

    • removeBlock

      public void removeBlock​(int x, int y, int z)
      Remove a block from the mesh and make it nothing instead. This method should not be used manually, use the WorldInteraction instead
      Parameters:
      x - x array position of the block to remove.
      y - y array position of the block to remove.
      z - z array position of the block to remove.
